eventName: Come Catastrophes or Wakes of Vultures
storyInfo: After watching groups of residents leave their homes to be shipped off to the frontier, Jessica finally makes up her mind to help the locals reclaim their money from the bank.

attributes.content: New Year's came and went, but the freezing wind and snow continue to nip at Davistown, leaving not a shred of warmth.
Amidst the crowd outside the plate waiting for their ride, Miles drowsily thinks to himself—how long has it been since he's waited for a bus like this in the cold.
So what kind of place are you headed to in the frontier, old man?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: ...Somewhere warmer than here, at least.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Don't worry about me. They showed me mercy by allowing me to be buried along with my old neighbors.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I'm sorry... I'm so sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: What's done is done, kid. Best to just move on, and stay out of trouble.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Right, I just remembered. The last time I was waiting for a ride like this, it was to head to a nomadic city to attend my little sister's funeral.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: It was a cold day just like this one. Helena, Woodrow, and Leone... They all stayed with me while I waited for the convoy to show up.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I was holding a bouquet stuck inside a vase from Helena's diner, and wearing an old suit Leone lent me. Freezed my ass off for hours.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Weirdly, I can even clearly remember how long Woodrow's beard was that day. But everything after I got on the bus is just a blur, like looking through a layer of frosted glass.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I think I went to a huge city, but it also seemed smaller than Davistown. I think I cried a lot, but it also feels like I didn't cry at all...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: After that, it's just me hopping on a bus back to town, and my friends helping me get off.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I actually do remember what happened after that. I went to Helena's place and started drinkin' and drinkin'. Got pretty sloshed, but I somehow still remember everything I said that night.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: The convoy to the frontier has arrived! Hop on the bus, people of Davistown!
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: 'Even my precious baby sister's gone. All I got left is Davistown, and I'm gonna follow her to the grave, dammit.'
'You hear me, Leone? I'm gonna dig my grave here! And when the time comes...'
Don't you act like I've forgotten, Miles!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You told me, 'when the time comes, stuff my body into the plant's furnace, and see if... my ashes can... make the people here sneeze...'
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The engineer throws his head back and takes another huge swig.
As soon as you finished talking, the town was perfectly fine, but I was the one who got the mother of all sneezes.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Haha... Hahaha...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Back then, nobody laughed. Nobody could laugh at all. But now, it seems so damn funny. What do you think?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Don't just sit there all quiet! Drink, Miles, drink!
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Sorry we're late.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Woodrow, Helena... Where's Leone?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Right before we left, he said he needed some time to figure things out. Said he'd be back later, then popped open another bottle.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: ...But we're out of time.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: No big deal. If anything... maybe it's better this way.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Tch, damn weather... Why does it have to be so cold?!
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Well, once you're on that bus, you can kiss this weather goodbye.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woodrow!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Ain't nothing wrong with what he said.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: I'm sorry...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: *sigh*... Stop apologizing, Jessica. This whole damn time, it was the bank's fault, Blacksteel's fault, and sometimes, even our own fault. But you... you never did nothing wrong.
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: So stop blaming yourself. We weren't expecting much from you in the first place—
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: Miles realizes his mistake the moment the words leave his lips, but before he has a chance to explain himself, the convoy leader has already grabbed his arm.
If you had something to say, you should've said it earlier! Now get on, you're the last one!
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Jessica, I...
attributes.name: Miles

attributes.content: If we wait any longer, I trust you'll take personal responsibility for any Rusthammers or Catastrophes that show up?
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Now get a move on!
attributes.name: Convoy Leader

attributes.content: Don't take it the wrong way, Jessica. That's not how he meant it.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I know... But, he's not wrong either...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I've done so much here, but in the end... I never actually accomplished anything.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: ...Nothing changed.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Who is it? Oh, Woodrow? Or is it Helena? Stop rushing me, I already said I'm over it. I'm gonna go see Miles off—
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: What do you want?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Hah, what, you're here to chase me out too?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Unlike what Leone is used to seeing, Sylvia does not apologize, bow her head, and run off.
She stands there for a moment, tightly clutching something to her chest, then stiffly puts one foot forward and walks into the diner.
She keeps walking until she reaches the seat closest to the counter, sits down with her back to the door, and stares straight at the empty chair in front of her.
Mr. Theremin... Are Woodrow and Helena... going to come back?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Woodrow? And Helena? How's that any of your business? They went to see Miles off—
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The cold wind blowing in from the crack in the door Sylvia left behind whispers as it circles past the mouth of the empty beer bottle.
It sends a shiver down Leone's spine.
They went to see Miles off and will be back in a bit. But nobody wants to see you, got it? If you do, then scram. Just... leave me alone.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Sylvia's fingers are tightly clasped together on top of the table.
She gulps down a mouthful of water and forces herself to turn and look at Leone's face. It is then that he finally sees what she had been clutching.
A ring, silver in color, with a few diamonds inlaid across it.
Mr. Theremin, I can't—
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Who gave you that ring hanging around your neck?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The ring?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Couldn't have been me or Benny... So that leaves...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...Him?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Their eyes meet.
Sylvia nods slightly and clutches the ring once again, her eyes burning with an almost crazed determination.
The look in her eyes reminds Leone of someone. Carl's eyes.
The night before he departed, he disappeared for a few hours. And when he returned, his eyes looked exactly like those of the person now in front of him.
You know, Jessica... our team also has to pull out of Davistown the moment we receive the order. Whatever else happens here, we have to return to the ship.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I know. I know that...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: We're leaving. Miles has already left. Woodrow and Helena said they're leaving too. Leone probably won't stay either... Everyone will be gone.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: But I... What have I done for them?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Well, if you ask me... You cleaned up the bandits terrorizing the place, helped Leone save his house, and told Cliff that the bank had overstepped its authority. Even if you don't want to acknowledge it.
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: But in the end... it was all in vain. I... I let everyone down.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Or maybe even worse, it's just as Miles said... Nobody expected anything from me in the first place. It's all because I went and stuck my nose where it didn't belong...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Jessica!
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: No, even so, I still...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Laura, I need to go out for a walk.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Now's not the time for that. We're about to return to the landship... I'll help you pack your stuff, so just take a nice nap. I'll wake you up when it's time to go, okay?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: ...I have to do this.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Where are you going?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I don't know.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You sure about this?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: Mhm.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Don't take too long, okay?
attributes.name: Laura

attributes.content: I... I'll try my best.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Stop drinking already, Leone.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: —Wait, you're sober?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: As sober as I ever am.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Wait... and Sylvia? What's she doing here?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: She insisted on waiting for you two to get back, so she could have a chat with all of us.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Sylvia stands up from her seat, still gripping the ring tightly. Blue veins are visible across her white knuckles.
Helena, Woodrow, Mr. Theremin...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: I know of... some money in the bank.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Of course there's money in the bank. What's the point of telling us that?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I mean... Blacksteel delivered a large sum of cash to serve as reserve funds. And it's all... sitting in a vault right now.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: The bank wants to prepare for Davistown's new residents.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: They're going to clear out the entire plate to welcome the precision technicians, R&D personnel, and managers that form the cornerstones of the new industries...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: To meet the demand for their deposits and loans, there's... a lot more cash in the bank than usual.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Maybe... enough to let a large group of people start a new life in the frontier.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...So, that's the situation.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: That's it? What are you getting at, Sylvia?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: ...Someone actually sober wouldn't be asking that, Leone.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: But here's my question.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: If you're saying what I think you are, I need to know.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sylvia, do you expect us to return the money to its rightful owners?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Or do you want us to take it...?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: By force.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sylvia nods slightly in an almost unrecognizable manner, then continues fidgeting with the ring on her chest while waiting for the final judgment.
The diner is deathly quiet.
...At least we're all on the same page.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Leone, you in or not?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Say something.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No, I... I know this money should've been ours, but... I don't wanna be criminal scum. Like those bandits.
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: You really think the bandits were the biggest crooks in Davistown?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: So, you're with her, Woodrow?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: No?!
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I admire her courage, but this is too much of a long shot.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: For example... Sylvia, you got a map of the bank?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...Yes.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Give it here.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I don't have anything on paper, but I do know that it's a hundred paces from the bank's front entrance to the master control switch. Based on my stride, that'd make it about two hundred feet...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Before that, there are three turns, at steps forty-four, seventy-four, and ninety-three. The landmarks are a potted plant, a floor lamp, and a counter.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: From the master control switch to the entrance of the vault, you have to pass through the reception room, go through a hidden doorway, and then down a thirty-six-step stairwell. Afterward, there will be a straight path, which will take—
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: You... You actually memorized all that?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Doubtful.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Sylvia, how far is it from your seat to the entrance of the diner?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I just walked eighteen paces, and after the sixth step, I made a right-angle turn for a total distance of about thirty-six feet.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: She didn't memorize it... She's just been there countless times. As you just heard.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woodrow, what do you reckon our odds are if you joined us? And what about with Leone?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: How're we supposed to get all this cash out to the frontier without leaving any traces?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: I can take care of that.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I don't doubt you can survive out there, but what about the money...?
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Helena lets out a sigh. She nimbly hops over the bar counter, picks up the knife on the table, and bends down to pry up the floorboards.
Creak, creak...
Pop.
A cloud of dust, ancient and full of history, rises from her feet.
Don't act like you got me all figured out just 'cause you found that box when the water leaked.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: The man who left me this place as well as his passbook... Any idea when I met him?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Surprise me.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: When I was eighteen.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: At the time, my old man was trying to sell me to his boss's son, so he could climb up the ranks.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: When I heard the news, I ran to the bar and hid there all night, which is where I met him... In the end, we hopped on his burdenbeast in the dead of night and rode until that stifling old place was nothing but a distant memory.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Wait, you eloped with him when you were eighteen, but by the time you got here...
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: We'd broken up. Hadn't seen him for over two decades.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I lived by my lonesome in the frontier for over twenty years.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You think after all that time, I wouldn't have learned how to line my petticoats with goldbacks?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Helena flashes a sweet smile, removes the weapon from her shoulder, and places it on the table in front of Sylvia.
If you boys ain't in, I'll do it myself.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: You and Sylvia... are going to rob a bank? Just the two of you?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: Maybe I'll be caught outside the vault, maybe I'll get trapped inside and end up a pile of bones buried in cash. Maybe I'll die trying to escape... Either way, as long as I draw breath, I will see this done.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: That's how I'm approaching this, anyhow.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Now, I need to know where you two stand.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Leone takes out a wrench from his toolbelt and places it next to Helena's weapon.
Your move, Woody.
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: Who's there?!
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Jessica? What are you— Why now of all times?
attributes.name: Helena

attributes.content: I... I don't know.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You don't know?
attributes.name: Leone

attributes.content: But... I need to do something. I need to make a difference.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If what Miles said is still bothering you, you'd best just forget about it.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You still got the time, the energy, to do so many great things. No need to tie yourself down to Davistown and a bunch of old fogeys past their prime.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: No, Woodrow...
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Too many times now, I've had the drive, but kept falling short for any number of reasons... I didn't have the ability, or the time. The situation changed on me. Orders, or requests.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Even now, I'm not sure what it is I can do.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I'm stuck watching helplessly as you're all driven away one by one, to an uncertain future in the frontier.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If I don't make a difference this time, I feel like... I might get used to it. To never making a difference.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: And if that happens, I can see myself believing—to protect my own mental health—that I've always been incompetent. That I could never protect anyone.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I can see myself thinking there was never any special meaning to picking up a gun. That I'd just made a wrong turn somewhere in life and was stuck with it.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: I... I don't want that to happen.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: So much so that I'd die to make sure it doesn't.
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Um...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Sylvia?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: If you truly see this as your last chance... Well, this is also our last chance to take back what's rightfully ours from the bank. Will you help us, Jessica?
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: As soon as Sylvia stands up, Jessica sees the look on her face.
Her complexion is frighteningly pale, but her cheeks are unusually sanguine in a way that only serves to make the former more shocking.
Enough.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woodrow? Why are you pointing your gun at me?!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Forget everything you just heard, and scram.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Why? What's the meaning of this?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: We have to get to the bank...
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: Sylvia...
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: ...and take back what belongs to Davistown.
attributes.name: Sylvia

attributes.content: ...Take back?
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: Go, Jessica. Go back to your friends.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: Woodrow!
attributes.name: Jessica

attributes.content: You came here for a shoulder to cry on, and we offered you a hot drink and a pat on the shoulder. No more, no less.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: You're still young. Every day of your life is a new beginning. I'm serious.
attributes.name: Woodrow

attributes.content: As if her tears had frozen over and evaporated, Jessica's vision suddenly becomes clear.
She sees the unusual blush across Sylvia's cheeks. She sees the wrench and the unfamiliar weapon sitting on the table. She sees the dark hole in the muzzle of Woodrow's gun.
For the first time in her life, she makes up her mind in a split second.
She walks towards Woodrow's pistol, approaches Sylvia, and draws her own gun from her waist before placing it in on the table front of her.
I'm in.
attributes.name: Jessica
